column4: Can I get someone to PM me about a battery issue in Ubuntu 11.10
what does dmesg have to say
What specifically am I looking for, cause that's a crapload of info\
try dmesg|less   then hit /battery    then enter
ACPI: Deprecated procfs I/F for battery is loaded, please retry with CONFIG_ACPI_PROCFS_POWER clear and ACPI: Battery Slot [BAT1] (battery absent)
http://techinterplay.com/fix-toshiba-battery-issue-linux.html
uname -a
Linux [computername] 3.0.0-12-generic #20-Ubuntu SMP Fri Oct 7 14:56:25 UTC 2001 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
did you get my uname -a?
yes I did and am a little suprised tthat it has not been updated with that kerenel
me too to be honest. I'm a linux noobie, but it seems every distro I try has the same issue
would it help if I mentioned that my screen brightness never sticks on reboot? always goes to half brightness
it really looks like DSDT  file is umm.....
cat /proc/acpi/battery/BAT0/state
that's another thing, I don't have BAT0, only BAT1 and it says present: no
at least there is solution
Oh? And what might that be?
http://techinterplay.com/fix-toshiba-battery-issue-linux.html
I wouldn't even know where to start.
well there is a link :>)
cool good luck :>)
